weather_report:
As we awaken to the gentle embrace of a cloudy morning in Downtown San Francisco, the atmosphere is thick with the promise of rain. A residue of calm hangs over the city, where visibility, though muddied by low-hanging clouds, reveals the iconic silhouettes of the Golden Gate Bridge and the surrounding hills. Yet, the tranquility belies what is to come; the forecast warns that rain will arrive after 4 PM with an intensity that could transform our streets into rivulets by evening. Temperatures will hover in the cool embrace of the mid-50s, encouraging the city dwellers to consider their layers as winds shift from gentle breezes to hearty gusts, stirring up an air of restless anticipation.

Dressing for such a day demands a balance between comfort and preparedness; a waterproof jacket will serve you well, along with sturdy shoes to navigate the slick pavements. A stroll across the waterfront or a visit to one of the many local cafes might offer respite from the impending deluge, allowing you to savor a warm beverage while the city energetically prepares for the rain. As the sun sets, anticipate the symphony of raindrops serenading the sidewalks, inviting you to explore the character of San Francisco on a rainy evening, discovering hidden gems whose glow invites you to linger just a little longer before the winds sweep away the remnants of the day.
